metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35654 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Pillow before 8.1.0, TiffDecode has a heap-based buffer overflow when decoding crafted YCbCr files because of certain interpretation conflicts with LibTIFF in RGBA mode.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, affects 6.0.0 to 8.0.1, and only when used with libtiff 4.1.0 in focal, not 4.0.9 in bionic

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2').
pillow-python2 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
